Description: Typical range for industrial 1064 nm fiber lasers in glass cleaning to balance efficiency and safety; starting at 200 W for contamination removal without overheating. Max safe below 500 W to avoid thermal stress on float glass (melting point ~500°C). Source: IPG Photonics specs and studies in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Float Glass absorption and minimal subsurface damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal without glass damage
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
